en.value: <strong>The information shared about bicibus is that</strong>
en.comp:
Directions: Read the following passage and answer the questions that follow:

1. In Spain, children and their families ride bikes to school in large groups. The programme is called 'bicibus'. In Barcelona, the programme started recently with only five children and grew quickly to hundreds of riders. The path it follows is always posted ahead of time so everyone knows where to join.

2. Instead of riding in bike lanes or on sidewalks, the 'bicibus' takes over the entire street. The commuting time of bikers takes about twenty-five minutes. And with the ever-growing cycling and skating trend by kids taking part in this bike bus culture, the local police are helping them by stopping traffic. For this, the policemen ride in front of the bicibus as well as behind it.

3. This further makes the parents satisfied that with the additional security, their children will commute safely to school. With music playing and bike bells ringing, the bicibus feels like a party. Parents are hoping that the bicibus will help change ideas about how people can get around in the city. They want the city to create wider, kid-friendly bike lanes that are separate from car traffic. They point out that bicibus also helps cut down on pollution.

4. Recently, pictures and videos of the bicibus got a lot of attention on social media sites. Many people pointed out what a simple idea it is and how easy it is to get started. Already some other areas in Barcelona are also organizing bike buses.

options.value: it takes over the whole sidewalk.
it&#39;s safety is a concern for parents.

In Barcelona, the programme started recently with only five children and grew quickly to hundreds of riders. The path it follows is always posted ahead of time so everyone knows where to join.

2. Instead of riding in bike lanes or on sidewalks, the 'bicibus' takes over the entire street. The commuting time of bikers takes about twenty-five minutes. And with the ever-growing cycling and skating trend by kids taking part in this bike bus culture, the local police are helping them by stopping traffic. For this, the policemen ride in front of the bicibus as well as behind it.

3. This further makes the parents satisfied that with the additional security, their children will commute safely to school. With music playing and bike bells ringing, the bicibus feels like a party. Parents are hoping that the bicibus will help change ideas about how people can get around in the city. They want the city to create wider, kid-friendly bike lanes that are separate from car traffic. They point out that bicibus also helps cut down on pollution.

4. Recently, pictures and videos of the bicibus got a lot of attention on social media sites. Many people pointed out what a simple idea it is and how easy it is to get started. Already some other areas in Barcelona are also organizing bike buses.

Directions: Read the following poem and answer the questions that follow:

Some glory in their birth, some in their skill,

Some in their wealth, some in their bodies' force,

Some in their garments, though new-fangled ill,

Some in their hawks and hounds, some in their horses ______4.

And every humour hath his adjunct pleasure;

Wherein it finds a joy above the rest;

But these particulars are not my measure;

All these I better in one general best ______8.

Thy love is better than high birth to me,

Richer than wealth, prouder than garments' cost,

Of more delight than hawks or horses be;

And having thee, of all men's pride I boast _____ 12.

Wretched in this alone, that thou mayst take;

All this away, and me most wretched make ______14.

A twelve-old child enjoys using puns. This enjoyment indicates that she has&nbsp;
<strong>Why was the bike so important for the couple?</strong>
en.comp:
Directions: Read the following passage and answer the questions that follow:

1. The bike, a red Bajaj Pulsar 150 was our only transport. My husband, Rajesh used it to go to his work, putting in 60 hours per week to support his family of 6 members. It was not easy for him and the bike was especially helpful in getting groceries from the store. It saved us many hours of walking long distances as our grocery store was at quite a distance from where we lived. Being the only mode of transport, it was much treasured by the family.

2. But one day, an unfortunate incident occurred. In the morning when I was going out for a morning walk, I was shocked to see that the bike was missing from its usual parking place. I was so sad that someone would steal our bike that I wrote to the local daily and told them our sad story. Shortly after that, several people offered help. I was shocked to know that one wonderful stranger even bought a bike, then called my husband to pick it up from his place. Once again, my husband had a way to get to and from his work. It really is amazing that a complete stranger would go out of his way to help someone he had never even met.

3. It is commonly believed that a smile can be passed from one person to another. But I would say that such acts of kindness from one stranger to another are even more effective. This experience has had a spreading effect on our lives because it strengthened our faith in humanity as a whole. And it has influenced us to be more mindful of ways. We, too, can share such kind acts with others. No matter how big or small an act of kindness, it shows that someone cares and the results can be everlasting.

options.value: The man earned his livelihood by giving the bike on rent.
It was their only valuable possession.
It was a strong and flashy bike.
They needed it in their day-to-day life.

en.value: <strong>Why was Paul in full use of his faculties in spite of higher blood carbon dioxide ?</strong>
en.comp:
Directions: Read the following passage and answer the questions that follow:

1. Paul's blood carbon level was a constant high, indicating that the work of breathing was overwhelming. His blood test suggested that some of the excess carbon dioxide had been accumulating over days to weeks, as his lung disease and debility had advanced. Because his brain had slowly become acclimated to higher than normal levels of carbon dioxide, he remained lucid. He observed. He understood the ominous tests results, as he was wheeled to an intensive care unit, one where so many of his own patients had struggled before or after neurosurgery, their families assembled by their bedsides.

2. Through the night, Paul discussed the question in a series of conversations with his physicians, his family, and then me. Around midnight, the critical care attendant came in to discuss treatment options with his family. The only remaining interaction would be to put Paul onto a ventilator. But was that what he wanted ?

3. I knew that our life was going to change forever. It would be a long, strenuous and tense journey in which both of us would have to stand for each other. This was an illness which can either bring a couple together or destroy the relation forever. The main concern was whether Paul would remain too ill to ever come off the ventilator. Would he be lost to delirium and then organ failure? Paul explored the alternative in lieu of intubation and finally decided he would choose 'comfort care', though death would come more surely and swiftly in that case.

options.value: Because of continuous high pollution levels
Because his brain had become used to higher carbon dioxide levels
Because his debility was at a higher stage

1. Paul's blood carbon level was a constant high, indicating that the work of breathing was overwhelming. His blood test suggested that some of the excess carbon dioxide had been accumulating over days to weeks, as his lung disease and debility had advanced. Because his brain had slowly become acclimated to higher than normal levels of carbon dioxide, he remained lucid. He observed. He understood the ominous tests results, as he was wheeled to an intensive care unit, one where so many of his own patients had struggled before or after neurosurgery, their families assembled by their bedsides.

2. Through the night, Paul discussed the question in a series of conversations with his physicians, his family, and then me. Around midnight, the critical care attendant came in to discuss treatment options with his family. The only remaining interaction would be to put Paul onto a ventilator. But was that what he wanted ?

3. I knew that our life was going to change forever. It would be a long, strenuous and tense journey in which both of us would have to stand for each other. This was an illness which can either bring a couple together or destroy the relation forever. The main concern was whether Paul would remain too ill to ever come off the ventilator. Would he be lost to delirium and then organ failure? Paul explored the alternative in lieu of intubation and finally decided he would choose 'comfort care', though death would come more surely and swiftly in that case.

en.value: <strong>&lsquo;Acclimated&rsquo; in para 1 means &lsquo;getting adapted to a new ________&#39;</strong>

en.value: Storytelling should be used frequently in classrooms of young learners because :&nbsp;

options.value: It provides space for teachers to engage in another academic task.&nbsp;
It lays the foundation of logical understanding and imagination.&nbsp;
It lays the foundation for other academic engagements.&nbsp;
It allows students to imagine and relax.&nbsp;&nbsp;

en.value: Who proposed the concept of transformational grammar which refers to a finite set of rules to generate sentences and can be used to produce more sentences in that language ?&nbsp;
A teacher engages her learners in a fun activity before beginning a new lesson. The purpose of this activity is to :&nbsp;

options.value: Discipline the learners before the lesson&nbsp;
Divert the attention of the learners
Reduce the workload of the teacher&nbsp;

en.value: In a class-V classroom, a teacher uses a newspaper advertisement to discuss the content and design of the advertisement. Here the newspaper is _______.
_______ is a motor disorder that affects the coordination of the tongue and lips to produce sounds.&nbsp;
During a task, a student is talking to himself about ways in which he can proceed with the task. This kind of &lsquo;private speech&rsquo; is a sign of :&nbsp;
A teacher is finalizing some topics for the students of class 5 to write a paragraph. At this stage he should choose the topics related to :&nbsp;
At primary level a teacher generally motivates learners for drawing and colouring as it helps in :

options.value: engaging learners to maintain discipline in the class.&nbsp;
entertaining learners by engaging them in fun activities.&nbsp;&nbsp;
relaxing the child from the boredom of learning.&nbsp;

en.value: While teaching poem in a constructivist classroom a teacher should&nbsp;

options.value: read the text and ask the students to repeat after him.&nbsp;
ask the students to memorise the word meanings of difficult words in the text.&nbsp;
focus on the rules of grammar and its drill work.&nbsp;&nbsp;
ask the students to interact in groups and give their personal response to the poem.&nbsp;

en.value: To assess reading skill at primary level, a language teacher should most importantly focus on :&nbsp;

options.value: associating the letters with its sound.&nbsp;

en.value: A teacher of class-Il displays posters, children&rsquo;s work, poems, sight words, etc. on the classroom wall to make the learners notice language through these means. What should this be described as?&nbsp;
The words that a child uses as productive vocabulary are the words&nbsp;

options.value: that he/she uses in writing and speaking.&nbsp;
which are recognized when someone speaks.&nbsp;

en.value: Multilingualism in school education means&nbsp;

options.value: learning of many languages from foundational stage.&nbsp;
using the language of learners in teaching-learning process.&nbsp;
language-in-education policy of the State for preparatory stage.&nbsp;
teaching only home language to learners.&nbsp;

en.value: Which among the following is a correct statement ?&nbsp;

options.value: When children start learning English they are like a clean slate.&nbsp;
In class-1 children do not know English at all.&nbsp;
Children come to school with a treasure of experience of their own language.&nbsp;
Children should be given a list of English words on the very first day in school.&nbsp;

en.value: At primary level, teacher focuses on reading aloud rather than silent reading in classroom to :

options.value: enable learners to be attentive and wait for their turn.&nbsp;&nbsp;
enable learners to read with correct pronunciation using punctuation marks.&nbsp;&nbsp;

instructions.value: The test contain 5 sections having total 150 questions.
Each question has 4 options out of which only one is correct.
You have to finish the test in 150 minutes.
There is no negative marking in this test.
<p>You will be awarded 1&nbsp;mark for each correct answer.</p>
There is no negative marking for the questions that you have not attempted.
<p><span style="font-family: arial;">You can write this test only once.&nbsp;</span>Make sure that you complete the&nbsp;test before you submit the test and/or close the browser.</p>
